achievements.BalloonPopped.description: (Client) Function: achievements.BalloonPopped() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of balloons burst. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Popper' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.Count.description: (Client and Menu) Function: achievements.Count() Returns the amount of achievements in Garry's Mod.

achievements.EatBall.description: (Client) Function: achievements.EatBall() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of balls eaten. Once this count reaches 200, the 'Ball Eater' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.GetCount.description: (Client and Menu) Function: achievements.GetCount() Retrieves progress of given achievement

achievements.GetDesc.description: (Client and Menu) Function: achievements.GetDesc() Retrieves description of given achievement

achievements.GetGoal.description: (Client and Menu) Function: achievements.GetGoal() Retrieves progress goal of given achievement

achievements.GetName.description: (Client and Menu) Function: achievements.GetName() Retrieves name of given achievement

achievements.IncBaddies.description: (Client) Function: achievements.IncBaddies() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of baddies killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'War Zone' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.IncBystander.description: (Client) Function: achievements.IncBystander() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of innocent animals killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Innocent Bystander' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.IncGoodies.description: (Client) Function: achievements.IncGoodies() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of friendly NPCs killed. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Bad Friend' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.IsAchieved.description: (Client and Menu) Function: achievements.IsAchieved() Used in GMod 12 in the achievements menu to show the user if they have unlocked certain achievements.

achievements.Remover.description: (Client) Function: achievements.Remover() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of things removed. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Destroyer' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnedNPC.description: (Client) Function: achievements.SpawnedNPC() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of NPCs spawned. Once this count reaches 1000, the 'Procreator' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnedProp.description: (Client) Function: achievements.SpawnedProp() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of props spawned. Once this count reaches 5000, the 'Creator' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnedRagdoll.description: (Client) Function: achievements.SpawnedRagdoll() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of ragdolls spawned. Once this count reaches 2000, the 'Dollhouse' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnMenuOpen.description: (Client) Function: achievements.SpawnMenuOpen() {{Internal}}Adds one to the count of how many times the spawnmenu has been opened. Once this count reaches 100,000, the 'Menu User' achievement is unlocked.

cam.ApplyShake.description: (Client) Function: cam.ApplyShake() Shakes the screen at a certain position.

cam.End.description: (Client) Function: cam.End() Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

cam.IgnoreZ.description: (Client) Function: cam.IgnoreZ() Tells the renderer to ignore the depth buffer and draw any upcoming operation "ontop" of everything that was drawn yet.

cam.PushModelMatrix.description: (Client) Function: cam.PushModelMatrix() Pushes the specified matrix onto the render matrix stack. Unlike opengl, this will replace the current model matrix.

cam.StartOrthoView.description: (Client) Function: cam.StartOrthoView() Sets up a new 3d context using orthographic projection.

cookie.Delete.description: (All) Function: cookie.Delete() Deletes a cookie on the client.

coroutine.create.description: (All) Function: coroutine.create() Creates a coroutine of the given function.

coroutine.resume.description: (All) Function: coroutine.resume() Resumes the given coroutine and passes the given vararg to either the function arguments or the {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|yield}} that is inside that function and returns whatever yield is called with the next time or by the final return in the function.

coroutine.running.description: (All) Function: coroutine.running() Returns the active coroutine or nil if we are not within a coroutine.

coroutine.status.description: (All) Function: coroutine.status() Returns the status of the coroutine passed to it, the possible statuses are "suspended", "running", and "dead".

coroutine.wait.description: (Shared) Function: coroutine.wait() Yield's the coroutine for so many seconds before returning.

coroutine.wrap.description: (All) Function: coroutine.wrap() Returns a function which calling is equivalent with calling {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|resume}} with the coroutine and all extra parameters.

coroutine.yield.description: (All) Function: coroutine.yield() Pauses the active coroutine and passes all additional variables to the call of {{LibraryFunction|coroutine|resume}} that resumed the coroutine last time, and returns all additional variables that were passed to the previous call of resume.

cvars.AddChangeCallback.description: (All) Function: cvars.AddChangeCallback() Adds a callback to be called when the named convar changes.

cvars.RemoveChangeCallback.description: (All) Function: cvars.RemoveChangeCallback() Removes a callback for a convar using the the callback's identifier. The identifier should be the third argument specified for {{LibraryFunction|cvars|AddChangeCallback}}.

cvars.String.description: (All) Function: cvars.String() Retrieves console variable as a string.

debug.debug.description: (All) Function: debug.debug() Enters an interactive mode with the user, running each string that the user enters. Using simple commands and other debug facilities, the user can inspect global and local variables, change their values, evaluate expressions, and so on. A line containing only the word cont finishes this function, so that the caller continues its execution.

debug.getfenv.description: (All) Function: debug.getfenv() Returns the environment of the passed object. This can be set with {{LibraryFunction|debug|setfenv}}

debug.gethook.description: (All) Function: debug.gethook() Returns the current hook settings of the passed thread. The thread argument can be omitted. This is unrelated to [[:Category:GM Hooks|gamemode hooks]]. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html

debug.getinfo.description: (All) Function: debug.getinfo() Returns debug information about a function.

debug.getlocal.description: (All) Function: debug.getlocal() Gets the name and value of a local variable indexed from the level

debug.getmetatable.description: (All) Function: debug.getmetatable() Returns the metatable of an object. This function ignores the metatable's __metatable field.

debug.getregistry.description: (All) Function: debug.getregistry() Returns the internal Lua registry table.

debug.getupvalue.description: (All) Function: debug.getupvalue() Used for getting variable values in an index from the passed function

debug.setfenv.description: (All) Function: debug.setfenv() Sets the environment of the passed object.

debug.sethook.description: (All) Function: debug.sethook() Sets the given function as a Lua hook. This is completely different to gamemode hooks. The thread argument can be completely omitted and calling this function with no arguments will remove the current hook. This is used by default for infinite loop detection. More information on hooks can be found at http://www.lua.org/pil/23.2.html

debug.setlocal.description: (All) Function: debug.setlocal() Sets a local variable's value.

debug.setmetatable.description: (All) Function: debug.setmetatable() Sets the table's metatable.

debug.setupvalue.description: (All) Function: debug.setupvalue() Sets the variable indexed from func

debug.Trace.description: (All) Function: debug.Trace() Prints out the lua function call stack to the console.

debug.traceback.description: (All) Function: debug.traceback() Returns a full execution stack trace.

debug.upvalueid.description: (All) Function: debug.upvalueid() Returns an unique identifier for the upvalue indexed from func

debug.upvaluejoin.description: (All) Function: debug.upvaluejoin() Make the n1-th upvalue of the Lua closure f1 refer to the n2-th upvalue of the Lua closure f2.

jit.status.description: (All) Function: jit.status() Returns the status of the JIT compiler and the current optimizations enabled.

killicon.Add.description: (Client) Function: killicon.Add() Creates new kill icon using a texture.

killicon.AddAlias.description: (Client) Function: killicon.AddAlias() Creates kill icon from existing one.

killicon.AddFont.description: (Client) Function: killicon.AddFont() Adds kill icon for given weapon/entity class using special font.

killicon.Draw.description: (Client) Function: killicon.Draw() Draws a kill icon.

killicon.Exists.description: (Client) Function: killicon.Exists() Checks if kill icon exists for given class.

killicon.GetSize.description: (Client) Function: killicon.GetSize() Returns the size of a kill icon.

language.Add.description: (Client and Menu) Function: language.Add() Adds a language item. Language placeholders preceded with "#" are replaced with full text in Garry's Mod once registered with this function.

language.GetPhrase.description: (Client and Menu) Function: language.GetPhrase() Retrieves the translated version of inputted string. Useful for concentrating multiple translated strings.

list.Add.description: (All) Function: list.Add() Adds an item to a named list

list.Contains.description: (All) Function: list.Contains() Returns true if the list contains the value. (as a value - not a key)

list.Get.description: (All) Function: list.Get() Returns a copy of the list stored at identifier

list.GetForEdit.description: (All) Function: list.GetForEdit() Returns the actual table of the list stored at identifier. Modifying this will affect the stored list

list.Set.description: (All) Function: list.Set() Sets a specific position in the named list to a value.

markup.Parse.description: (Client) Function: markup.Parse() Parses markup into a MarkupObject.

math.abs.description: (All) Function: math.abs() Calculates the absolute value of a number (effectively removes any negative sign).

math.acos.description: (All) Function: math.acos() Returns the arc cosine of the given number.

math.AngleDifference.description: (All) Function: math.AngleDifference() Calculates the difference between two angles.

math.Approach.description: (All) Function: math.Approach() Gradually approaches the target value by the specified amount.

math.ApproachAngle.description: (All) Function: math.ApproachAngle() Increments an angle towards another by specified rate.

math.asin.description: (All) Function: math.asin() Returns the arc sine of the given number.

math.atan.description: (All) Function: math.atan() Returns the arc tangents of the given number.

math.atan2.description: (All) Function: math.atan2() Returns math.atan(y / x) in radians. The result is between -math.pi and math.pi.

math.BinToInt.description: (All) Function: math.BinToInt() Converts a binary string into a number.

math.BSplinePoint.description: (All) Function: math.BSplinePoint() Basic code for [[wikipedia:BÃ©zier curve|BÃ©zier-Spline]] algorithm.

math.calcBSplineN.description: (All) Function: math.calcBSplineN() Basic code for Bezier-Spline algorithm.

math.ceil.description: (All) Function: math.ceil() Ceils or rounds a number up.

math.Clamp.description: (All) Function: math.Clamp() Clamps a number between a minimum and maximum value

math.cos.description: (All) Function: math.cos() Returns cosine of given angle.

math.cosh.description: (All) Function: math.cosh() Returns hyperbolic cosine of the given number.

math.deg.description: (All) Function: math.deg() Converts radians to degrees.

math.Distance.description: (All) Function: math.Distance() Returns the difference between two points in 2D space.

math.EaseInOut.description: (All) Function: math.EaseInOut() Calculates the progress of a value fraction, taking in to account given easing fractions

math.exp.description: (All) Function: math.exp() Returns the x power of the euler constant.

math.floor.description: (All) Function: math.floor() Floors or rounds a number down.

math.fmod.description: (All) Function: math.fmod() Returns the modulus of the specified values.

math.frexp.description: (All) Function: math.frexp() used to split the number value into a normalized fraction and an exponent. Two values are returned: the first is a value always in the range 1/2 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) and the second is an exponent.

math.IntToBin.description: (All) Function: math.IntToBin() Converts an integer to a binary (base-2) string.

math.ldexp.description: (All) Function: math.ldexp() Takes a normalised number and returns the floating point representation.

math.log.description: (All) Function: math.log() With one argument, return the natural logarithm of x (to base e).

math.log10.description: (All) Function: math.log10() Returns the base-10 logarithm of x. This is usually more accurate than math.log(x, 10).

math.max.description: (All) Function: math.max() Returns the largest value of all arguments.

math.min.description: (All) Function: math.min() Returns the smallest value of all arguments.

math.mod.description: (All) Function: math.mod() {{Deprecated|This is removed in Lua versions later than what GMod is currently using. You should use the % operator or {{LibraryFunction|math|fmod}} instead.}}

math.modf.description: (All) Function: math.modf() Returns the integral and fractional component of the modulo operation.

math.NormalizeAngle.description: (All) Function: math.NormalizeAngle() Normalizes angle, so it returns value between -180 and 180.

math.pow.description: (All) Function: math.pow() Returns x raised to the power y.

math.rad.description: (All) Function: math.rad() Converts an angle in degrees to it's equivalent in radians.

math.Rand.description: (All) Function: math.Rand() Returns a random float between min and max.

math.random.description: (All) Function: math.random() When called without arguments, returns a uniform pseudo-random real number in the range 0 to 1 which includes 0 but excludes 1.

math.randomseed.description: (All) Function: math.randomseed() Seeds the "seed" for the random generator, which will cause {{LibraryFunction|math|random}} to return the same sequence of numbers.

math.Remap.body: math.Remap(${1:number value}, ${2:number inMin}, ${3:number inMax}, ${4:number outMin}, ${5:number outMax})$0
math.Remap.description: (All) Function: math.Remap() Remaps the value from one range to another

math.Round.description: (All) Function: math.Round() Rounds the given value to the nearest whole number or to the given decimal places.

math.sin.description: (All) Function: math.sin() Returns sine of given angle.

math.sinh.description: (All) Function: math.sinh() Returns hyperbolic sine of the given number.

math.sqrt.description: (All) Function: math.sqrt() Returns the square root of the number.

math.tan.description: (All) Function: math.tan() Returns tangents of given angle.

math.tanh.description: (All) Function: math.tanh() Returns hyperbolic tangents of the given number.

math.TimeFraction.description: (All) Function: math.TimeFraction() Returns the fraction of where the current time is relative to the start and end times

matproxy.Add.description: (Client) Function: matproxy.Add() Adds a material proxy.

matproxy.Call.description: (Client) Function: matproxy.Call() Called by the engine from OnBind

matproxy.Init.description: (Client) Function: matproxy.Init() Called by the engine from OnBind

matproxy.ShouldOverrideProxy.description: (Client) Function: matproxy.ShouldOverrideProxy() Called by engine, returns true if we're overriding a proxy

menu.RecordFrame.description: (Client) Function: menu.RecordFrame() Used by "Demo to Video" to record the frame.

menubar.Init.description: (Client) Function: menubar.Init() Creates the menu bar ( The bar at the top of the screen when holding C or Q in sandbox ) and docks it to the top of the screen. It will not appear.

menubar.IsParent.description: (Client) Function: menubar.IsParent() Checks if the supplied panel is parent to the menubar

menubar.ParentTo.description: (Client) Function: menubar.ParentTo() Parents the menubar to the panel and displays the menubar.

mesh.AdvanceVertex.description: (Client) Function: mesh.AdvanceVertex() Pushes the new vertex data onto the render stack.

mesh.Begin.description: (Client) Function: mesh.Begin() Starts a new dynamic mesh. If an IMesh is passed, it will use that mesh instead.

mesh.Color.description: (Client) Function: mesh.Color() Sets the color to be used for the next vertex.

mesh.End.description: (Client) Function: mesh.End() Ends the mesh and renders it.

mesh.Normal.description: (Client) Function: mesh.Normal() Sets the normal to be used for the next vertex.

mesh.Position.description: (Client) Function: mesh.Position() Sets the position to be used for the next vertex.

mesh.Quad.description: (Client) Function: mesh.Quad() Draws a quad using 4 vertices.

mesh.QuadEasy.description: (Client) Function: mesh.QuadEasy() Draws a quad using a position, a normal and the size.

mesh.Specular.description: (Client) Function: mesh.Specular() Sets the specular map values.

mesh.TangentS.description: (Client) Function: mesh.TangentS() Sets the s tangent to be used.

mesh.TangentT.description: (Client) Function: mesh.TangentT() Sets the T tangent to be used.

mesh.TexCoord.description: (Client) Function: mesh.TexCoord() Sets the texture coordinates for the next vertex.

mesh.VertexCount.description: (Client) Function: mesh.VertexCount() Returns the amount of vertex that have yet been pushed.

motionsensor.GetColourMaterial.description: (Client and Menu) Function: motionsensor.GetColourMaterial() Returns the depth map material.

motionsensor.IsActive.description: (Client) Function: motionsensor.IsActive() Return whether a kinect is connected - and active (ie - Start has been called).

motionsensor.IsAvailable.description: (Client and Menu) Function: motionsensor.IsAvailable() Returns true if we have detected that there's a kinect connected to the PC

motionsensor.ProcessAngle.body: motionsensor.ProcessAngle(${1:table translator}, ${2:table sensor}, ${3:Vector pos}, ${4:Angle ang}, ${5:table special_vectors}, ${6:number boneid}, ${7:table v})$0

motionsensor.Start.description: (Client and Menu) Function: motionsensor.Start() This starts access to the kinect sensor. Note that this usually freezes the game for a couple of seconds.

motionsensor.Stop.description: (Client) Function: motionsensor.Stop() Stops the motion capture.

navmesh.AddWalkableSeed.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.AddWalkableSeed() Add this position and normal to the list of walkable positions, used before map generation with {{LibraryFunction|navmesh|BeginGeneration}}

navmesh.BeginGeneration.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.BeginGeneration() Starts the generation of a new navmesh.

navmesh.ClearWalkableSeeds.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.ClearWalkableSeeds() Clears all the walkable positions, used before calling {{LibraryFunction|navmesh|BeginGeneration}}.

navmesh.Find.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.Find() Returns a bunch of areas within distance, used to find hiding spots by NextBots for example.

navmesh.GetAllNavAreas.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetAllNavAreas() Returns an integer indexed table of all CNavAreas on the current map. If the map doesn't have a navmesh generated then this will return an empty table.

navmesh.GetEditCursorPosition.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetEditCursorPosition() Returns the position of the edit cursor when nav_edit is set to 1.

navmesh.GetMarkedArea.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetMarkedArea() Returns the currently marked CNavArea, for use with editing console commands.

navmesh.GetMarkedLadder.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetMarkedLadder() Returns the currently marked CNavLadder, for use with editing console commands.

navmesh.GetNavArea.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetNavArea() Returns the Nav Area contained in this position that also satisfies the elevation limit.

navmesh.GetNavAreaByID.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetNavAreaByID() Returns a CNavArea by the given ID.

navmesh.GetNavAreaCount.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetNavAreaCount() Returns the highest ID of all nav areas on the map. While this can be used to get all nav areas, this number may not actually be the actual number of nav areas on the map.

navmesh.GetNearestNavArea.body: navmesh.GetNearestNavArea(${1:Vector pos}, ${2:boolean anyZ=false}, ${3:number maxDist=10000}, ${4:boolean checkLOS=false}, ${5:boolean checkGround=true}, ${6:number team=TEAM_ANY=-2})$0
navmesh.GetNearestNavArea.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetNearestNavArea() Returns the closest CNavArea to given position at the same height, or beneath it.

navmesh.GetPlayerSpawnName.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.GetPlayerSpawnName() Returns the classname of the player spawn entity.

navmesh.IsGenerating.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.IsGenerating() Whether we're currently generating a new navmesh with {{LibraryFunction|navmesh|BeginGeneration}}.

navmesh.IsLoaded.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.IsLoaded() Returns true if a navmesh has been loaded when loading the map.

navmesh.Load.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.Load() Loads a new navmesh from the .nav file for current map discarding any changes made to the navmesh previously.

navmesh.Reset.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.Reset() Deletes every CNavArea}} and {{Type|CNavLadder on the map '''without saving the changes'''.

navmesh.Save.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.Save() Saves any changes made to navmesh to the .nav file.

navmesh.SetMarkedArea.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.SetMarkedArea() Sets the CNavArea as marked, so it can be used with editing console commands.

navmesh.SetMarkedLadder.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.SetMarkedLadder() Sets the CNavLadder as marked, so it can be used with editing console commands.

navmesh.SetPlayerSpawnName.description: (Server) Function: navmesh.SetPlayerSpawnName() Sets the classname of the default spawn point entity, used before generating a new navmesh with {{LibraryFunction|navmesh|BeginGeneration}}.

net.Broadcast.description: (Server) Function: net.Broadcast() Sends the currently built net message to all connected players.

net.BytesWritten.description: (Shared) Function: net.BytesWritten() Returns the size of the current message in bytes.

net.Incoming.description: (Shared) Function: net.Incoming() {{Internal|You may be looking for {{LibraryFunction|net|Receive}}.}}

net.ReadAngle.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadAngle() Reads an angle from the received net message.

net.ReadBit.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadBit() Reads a bit from the received net message.

net.ReadBool.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadBool() Reads a boolean from the received net message.

net.ReadColor.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadColor() Reads a {{Struct|Color}} from the current net message.

net.ReadData.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadData() Reads pure binary data from the message.

net.ReadDouble.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadDouble() Reads a double-precision number from the received net message.

net.ReadEntity.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadEntity() Reads an entity from the received net message. You should always check if the specified entity exists as it may have been removed and therefor NULL if it is outside of the players PVS or was already removed.

net.ReadFloat.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadFloat() Reads a floating point number from the received net message.

net.ReadHeader.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadHeader() Returns the "header" of the message which contains a short which can be converted to the corresponding message name via {{LibraryFunction|util|NetworkIDToString}}.

net.ReadInt.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadInt() Reads an integer from the received net message.

net.ReadMatrix.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadMatrix() Reads a VMatrix from the received net message.

net.ReadNormal.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadNormal() Reads a normal vector from the net message.

net.ReadString.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadString() Reads a null terminated string from the net stream. The size of the string is 8 bits plus 8 bits for every ASCII character in the string.

net.ReadTable.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadTable() Reads a table from the received net message.

net.ReadType.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadType() Reads a value from the net message with the specified type.

net.ReadUInt.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadUInt() Reads an unsigned integer with the specified number of bits from the received net message.

net.ReadVector.description: (Shared) Function: net.ReadVector() Reads a vector from the received net message.  Vectors sent by this function are compressed, which may result in precision loss. See {{LibraryFunction|net|WriteVector}} for more information.

net.Receive.description: (Shared) Function: net.Receive() Adds a net message handler. Only one receiver can be used to receive the net message.

net.Send.description: (Server) Function: net.Send() Sends the current message to the specified player, or to all players listed in the table.

net.SendOmit.description: (Server) Function: net.SendOmit() Sends the current message to all except the specified, or to all except all players in the table.

net.SendPAS.description: (Server) Function: net.SendPAS() Sends the message to all players that are in the same potentially audible set(PAS) as the position, or simply said, it adds all players that can potentially hear sounds from this position.

net.SendPVS.description: (Server) Function: net.SendPVS() Sends the message to all players the position is in the PVS of or, more simply said, sends the message to players that can potentially see this position.

net.SendToServer.description: (Client) Function: net.SendToServer() Sends the current message to the server.

net.Start.description: (Shared) Function: net.Start() Begins a new net message.

net.WriteAngle.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteAngle() Writes an angle to the current net message.

net.WriteBit.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteBit() Appends a boolean (as 1 or 0) to the current net message.

net.WriteBool.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteBool() Appends a boolean to the current net message. Alias of {{LibraryFunction|net|WriteBit}}

net.WriteColor.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteColor() Appends a {{Struct|Color}} to the current net message.

net.WriteData.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteData() Writes a chunk of binary data to the message.

net.WriteDouble.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteDouble() Appends a double-precision number to the current net message.

net.WriteEntity.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteEntity() Appends an entity to the current net message.

net.WriteFloat.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteFloat() Appends a float (number with decimals) to the current net message.

net.WriteInt.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteInt() Appends an integer (number without decimals) to the current net message.

net.WriteMatrix.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteMatrix() Writes a VMatrix to the current net message.

net.WriteNormal.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteNormal() Writes a normalized/direction vector ( Vector with length of 1 ) to the net message.

net.WriteString.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteString() Appends a string to the current net message. The size of the string is 8 bits plus 8 bits for every ASCII character in the string. The maximum allowed length of a single written string is 65533 characters.

net.WriteTable.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteTable() Appends a table to the current net message.

net.WriteType.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteType() Appends any type of value to the current net message.

net.WriteUInt.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteUInt() Appends an unsigned integer with the specified number of bits to the current net message.

net.WriteVector.description: (Shared) Function: net.WriteVector() Appends a vector to the current net message.

notification.AddLegacy.description: (Client and Menu) Function: notification.AddLegacy() Adds a standard notification to your screen.

notification.AddProgress.description: (Client and Menu) Function: notification.AddProgress() Adds a notification with an animated progress bar.

notification.Kill.description: (Client and Menu) Function: notification.Kill() Removes the notification after 0.8 seconds.

numpad.Activate.description: (Server) Function: numpad.Activate() Activates numpad key owned by the player

numpad.Deactivate.description: (Server) Function: numpad.Deactivate() Deactivates numpad key owned by the player

numpad.FromButton.description: (Server) Function: numpad.FromButton() Returns true during a function added with {{LibraryFunction| numpad|Register}} when the third argument to {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Activate}} is true.

numpad.OnDown.description: (Server) Function: numpad.OnDown() Calls a function registered with {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Register}} when a player presses specified key.

numpad.OnUp.description: (Server) Function: numpad.OnUp() Calls a function registered with {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Register}} when a player releases specified key.

numpad.Register.description: (Server) Function: numpad.Register() Registers a numpad library action for use with {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}} and {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnUp}}

numpad.Remove.description: (Server) Function: numpad.Remove() Removes a function added by either {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnUp}} or {{LibraryFunction|numpad|OnDown}}

numpad.Toggle.description: (Server) Function: numpad.Toggle() Either runs {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Activate}} or {{LibraryFunction|numpad|Deactivate}} depending on the key's current state

os.clock.description: (All) Function: os.clock() Returns the approximate cpu time the application ran.

os.date.description: (All) Function: os.date() Returns the date/time as a formatted string or in a table.

os.difftime.description: (All) Function: os.difftime() Subtracts the second of the first value and rounds the result.

os.time.description: (All) Function: os.time() Returns the system time in seconds past the unix epoch. If a table is supplied, the function attempts to build a system time with the specified table members.

package.seeall.description: (All) Function: package.seeall() Sets a metatable for module with its __index field referring to the global environment, so that this module inherits values from the global environment. To be used as an option to {{GlobalFunction|module}}.

physenv.AddSurfaceData.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.AddSurfaceData() {{Deprecated}}Loads the given surface properties as a string, follows the file format.

physenv.GetAirDensity.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.GetAirDensity() Returns the air density.

physenv.GetGravity.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.GetGravity() Gets the global gravity.

physenv.GetPerformanceSettings.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.GetPerformanceSettings() Gets the current performance settings in table form.

physenv.SetAirDensity.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.SetAirDensity() Sets the air density.

physenv.SetGravity.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.SetGravity() Sets the directional gravity, does not work on players.

physenv.SetPerformanceSettings.description: (Shared) Function: physenv.SetPerformanceSettings() Sets the performance settings.

player_manager.AddValidHands.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.AddValidHands() Assigns view model hands to player model.

player_manager.AddValidModel.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.AddValidModel() Associates a simplified name with a path to a valid player model.

player_manager.AllValidModels.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.AllValidModels() Returns the entire list of valid player models.

player_manager.ClearPlayerClass.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.ClearPlayerClass() Clears a player's class association by setting their ClassID to 0

player_manager.GetPlayerClass.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.GetPlayerClass() Gets a players class

player_manager.OnPlayerSpawn.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.OnPlayerSpawn() Applies basic class variables when the player spawns.

player_manager.RegisterClass.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.RegisterClass() Register a class metatable to be assigned to players later

player_manager.RunClass.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.RunClass() Execute a named function within the player's set class

player_manager.SetPlayerClass.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.SetPlayerClass() Sets a player's class

player_manager.TranslatePlayerHands.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.TranslatePlayerHands() Retrieves correct hands for given player model. By default returns citizen hands.

player_manager.TranslatePlayerModel.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.TranslatePlayerModel() Returns the valid model path for a simplified name.

player_manager.TranslateToPlayerModelNam.description: (Shared) Function: player_manager.TranslateToPlayerModelName() Returns the simplified name for a valid model path of a player model.

player.CreateNextBot.description: (Server) Function: player.CreateNextBot() Similar to the serverside command "bot", this function creates a new Player bot with the given name. This bot will not obey to the usual "bot_*" commands, and it's the same bot base used in TF2 and CS:S.

player.GetAll.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetAll() Gets all the current players in the server (not including connecting clients).

player.GetBots.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetBots() Returns a table of all bots on the server.

player.GetByID.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetByID() Gets the player with the specified connection ID.

player.GetBySteamID.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetBySteamID() Gets the player with the specified SteamID.

player.GetBySteamID64.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetBySteamID64() Gets the player with the specified SteamID64.

player.GetByUniqueID.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetByUniqueID() Gets the player with the specified uniqueID (not recommended way to identify players).

player.GetCount.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetCount() Gives you the player count.

player.GetHumans.description: (Shared) Function: player.GetHumans() Returns a table of all human ( non bot/AI ) players.

presets.Add.description: (Client) Function: presets.Add() Adds preset to a preset group.

presets.GetTable.description: (Client) Function: presets.GetTable() Returns a table with preset names and values from a single preset group.

presets.Remove.description: (Client) Function: presets.Remove() Removes a preset entry from a preset group.

properties.Add.description: (Shared) Function: properties.Add() Add properties to the properties module

properties.GetHovered.description: (Client) Function: properties.GetHovered() Returns an entity player is hovering over with his cursor.

properties.OnScreenClick.description: (Shared) Function: properties.OnScreenClick() Checks if player hovers over any entities and open a properties menu for it.

properties.OpenEntityMenu.description: (Shared) Function: properties.OpenEntityMenu() Opens properties menu for given entity.

render.AddBeam.description: (Client) Function: render.AddBeam() Adds a beam segment to the beam started by {{LibraryFunction|render|StartBeam}}.

render.BlurRenderTarget.description: (Client) Function: render.BlurRenderTarget() Blurs the render target ( or a given texture )

render.BrushMaterialOverride.description: (Client) Function: render.BrushMaterialOverride() {{Warning|This function is broken and does absolutely nothing}}

render.Capture.description: (Client) Function: render.Capture() Captures a part of the current render target and returns the data as a binary string in the given format.

render.CapturePixels.description: (Client) Function: render.CapturePixels() Dumps the current render target and allows the pixels to be accessed by {{LibraryFunction|render|ReadPixel}}.

render.Clear.body: render.Clear(${1:number r}, ${2:number g}, ${3:number b}, ${4:number a}, ${5:boolean clearDepth}, ${6:boolean clearStencil})$0
render.Clear.description: (Client) Function: render.Clear() Clears the current render target and the specified buffers.

render.ClearBuffersObeyStencil.body: render.ClearBuffersObeyStencil(${1:number r}, ${2:number g}, ${3:number b}, ${4:number a}, ${5:boolean depth})$0
render.ClearBuffersObeyStencil.description: (Client) Function: render.ClearBuffersObeyStencil() Clears the current rendertarget for obeying the current stencil buffer conditions.

render.ClearDepth.description: (Client) Function: render.ClearDepth() Resets the depth buffer.

render.ClearRenderTarget.description: (Client) Function: render.ClearRenderTarget() Clears a render target

render.ClearStencil.description: (Client) Function: render.ClearStencil() Resets all values in the stencil buffer to zero.

render.ClearStencilBufferRectangle.description: (Client) Function: render.ClearStencilBufferRectangle() Sets the stencil value in a specified rect.

render.ComputeDynamicLighting.description: (Client) Function: render.ComputeDynamicLighting() Calculates the lighting caused by dynamic lights for the specified surface.

render.ComputeLighting.description: (Client) Function: render.ComputeLighting() Calculates the light color of a certain surface.

render.CopyRenderTargetToTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.CopyRenderTargetToTexture() Copies the currently active Render Target to the specified texture.

render.CopyTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.CopyTexture() Copies the contents of one texture to another

render.CullMode.description: (Client) Function: render.CullMode() Changes the cull mode.

render.DepthRange.description: (Client) Function: render.DepthRange() Set's the depth range of the upcoming render.

render.DrawBeam.body: render.DrawBeam(${1:Vector startPos}, ${2:Vector endPos}, ${3:number width}, ${4:number textureStart}, ${5:number textureEnd}, ${6:table color})$0

render.DrawBox.body: render.DrawBox(${1:Vector position}, ${2:Angle angles}, ${3:Vector mins}, ${4:Vector maxs}, ${5:table color}, ${6:boolean writeZ})$0
render.DrawBox.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawBox() Draws a box in 3D space.

render.DrawLine.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawLine() Draws a line in 3D space.

render.DrawQuad.body: render.DrawQuad(${1:Vector vert1}, ${2:Vector vert2}, ${3:Vector vert3}, ${4:Vector vert4}, ${5:table color=Color( 255, 255, 255 )})$0

render.DrawQuadEasy.body: render.DrawQuadEasy(${1:Vector position}, ${2:Vector normal}, ${3:number width}, ${4:number height}, ${5:table color}, ${6:number rotation})$0

render.DrawScreenQuad.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawScreenQuad() Draws the the current material set by {{LibraryFunction|render|SetMaterial}} to the whole screen.

render.DrawScreenQuadEx.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawScreenQuadEx() Draws the the current material set by {{LibraryFunction|render|SetMaterial}} to the area specified.

render.DrawSphere.body: render.DrawSphere(${1:Vector position}, ${2:number radius}, ${3:number longitudeSteps}, ${4:number latitudeSteps}, ${5:table color})$0
render.DrawSphere.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawSphere() Draws a sphere in 3D space. The material previously set with {{LibraryFunction|render|SetMaterial}} will be applied the sphere's surface.

render.DrawSprite.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawSprite() Draws a sprite in 3d space.

render.DrawTextureToScreen.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawTextureToScreen() Draws a texture over the whole screen.

render.DrawTextureToScreenRect.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawTextureToScreenRect() Draws a textured rectangle.

render.DrawWireframeBox.body: render.DrawWireframeBox(${1:Vector position}, ${2:Angle angle}, ${3:Vector mins}, ${4:Vector maxs}, ${5:table color}, ${6:boolean writeZ})$0
render.DrawWireframeBox.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawWireframeBox() Draws a wireframe box in 3D space.

render.DrawWireframeSphere.body: render.DrawWireframeSphere(${1:Vector position}, ${2:number radius}, ${3:number longitudeSteps}, ${4:number latitudeSteps}, ${5:table color}, ${6:boolean writeZ=false})$0
render.DrawWireframeSphere.description: (Client) Function: render.DrawWireframeSphere() Draws a wireframe sphere in 3d space.

render.EnableClipping.description: (Client) Function: render.EnableClipping() Sets the status of the clip renderer, returning previous state.

render.EndBeam.description: (Client) Function: render.EndBeam() Ends the beam mesh of a beam started with {{LibraryFunction|render|StartBeam}}.

render.FogColor.description: (Client) Function: render.FogColor() Sets the color of the fog.

render.FogEnd.description: (Client) Function: render.FogEnd() Sets the at which the fog reaches its max density.

render.FogMaxDensity.description: (Client) Function: render.FogMaxDensity() Sets the maximum density of the fog.

render.FogMode.description: (Client) Function: render.FogMode() Sets the mode of fog.

render.FogStart.description: (Client) Function: render.FogStart() Sets the distance at which the fog starts showing up.

render.GetAmbientLightColor.description: (Client) Function: render.GetAmbientLightColor() Returns the ambient color of the map.

render.GetBlend.description: (Client) Function: render.GetBlend() Returns the current alpha blending.

render.GetColorModulation.description: (Client) Function: render.GetColorModulation() Returns the current color modulation values as normals.

render.GetDXLevel.description: (Client) Function: render.GetDXLevel() Returns the maximum available directX version.

render.GetFogColor.description: (Client) Function: render.GetFogColor() Returns the current fog color.

render.GetFogDistances.description: (Client) Function: render.GetFogDistances() Returns the fog start and end distance.

render.GetFogMode.description: (Client) Function: render.GetFogMode() Returns the fog mode.

render.GetFullScreenDepthTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.GetFullScreenDepthTexture() Returns the _rt_FullFrameDepth texture. Alias of _rt_PowerOfTwoFB

render.GetLightColor.description: (Client) Function: render.GetLightColor() Gets the light exposure on the specified position.

render.GetPowerOfTwoTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.GetPowerOfTwoTexture() Returns the render target's power of two texture.

render.GetRenderTarget.description: (Client) Function: render.GetRenderTarget() Returns the currently active render target.

render.GetResolvedFullFrameDepth.description: (Client) Function: render.GetResolvedFullFrameDepth() Returns the _rt_ResolvedFullFrameDepth texture for SSAO depth.

render.GetScreenEffectTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.GetScreenEffectTexture() Obtain an ITexture}} of the screen. You must call {{LibraryFunction|render|UpdateScreenEffectTexture in order to update this texture with the currently rendered scene.

render.GetSuperFPTex.description: (Client) Function: render.GetSuperFPTex() <onlyinclude>Returns a floating point texture the same resolution as the screen.

render.GetSurfaceColor.description: (Client) Function: render.GetSurfaceColor() Performs a render trace and returns the color of the surface hit, this uses a low res version of the texture.

render.GetToneMappingScaleLinear.description: (Client) Function: render.GetToneMappingScaleLinear() Returns a vector representing linear tone mapping scale.

render.MaterialOverride.description: (Client) Function: render.MaterialOverride() Sets the render material override for all next calls of {{ClassFunction|Entity|DrawModel}}. Also overrides {{LibraryFunction|render|MaterialOverrideByIndex}}.

render.MaterialOverrideByIndex.description: (Client) Function: render.MaterialOverrideByIndex() Similar to {{LibraryFunction|render|MaterialOverride}}, but overrides the materials per index.

render.MaxTextureHeight.description: (Client) Function: render.MaxTextureHeight() Returns the maximum texture height the renderer can handle.

render.MaxTextureWidth.description: (Client) Function: render.MaxTextureWidth() Returns the maximum texture width the renderer can handle.

render.Model.description: (Client) Function: render.Model() Creates a new {{GlobalFunction|ClientsideModel}}, renders it at the specified pos/ang, and removes it. Can also be given an existing CSEnt to reuse instead.

render.ModelMaterialOverride.description: (Client) Function: render.ModelMaterialOverride() Sets a material to override a model's default material. Similar to {{ClassFunction|Entity|SetMaterial}} except it uses an IMaterial argument and it can be used to change materials on models which are part of the world geometry.

render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable.description: (Client) Function: render.OverrideAlphaWriteEnable() Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the alpha channel of the current render target.

render.OverrideBlendFunc.body: render.OverrideBlendFunc(${1:boolean enabled}, ${2:number srcBlend}, ${3:number destBlend}, ${4:number srcBlendAlpha}, ${5:number destBlendAlpha})$0

render.OverrideColorWriteEnable.description: (Client) Function: render.OverrideColorWriteEnable() Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the color channel of the current render target.

render.OverrideDepthEnable.description: (Client) Function: render.OverrideDepthEnable() Overrides the write behaviour of all next rendering operations towards the depth buffer.

render.PopCustomClipPlane.description: (Client) Function: render.PopCustomClipPlane() Removes the current active clipping plane from the clip plane stack.

render.PopFilterMag.description: (Client) Function: render.PopFilterMag() Pops the current texture magnification filter from the filter stack.

render.PopFilterMin.description: (Client) Function: render.PopFilterMin() Pops the current texture minification filter from the filter stack.

render.PopFlashlightMode.description: (Client) Function: render.PopFlashlightMode() Pops the current flashlight mode from the flashlight mode stack.

render.PopRenderTarget.description: (Client) Function: render.PopRenderTarget() Pops the last render target and viewport from the RT stack and sets them as the current render target and viewport.

render.PushCustomClipPlane.description: (Client) Function: render.PushCustomClipPlane() Pushes a new clipping plane of the clip plane stack and sets it as active.

render.PushFilterMag.description: (Client) Function: render.PushFilterMag() Pushes a texture filter onto the magnification texture filter stack.

render.PushFilterMin.description: (Client) Function: render.PushFilterMin() Pushes a texture filter onto the minification texture filter stack.

render.PushFlashlightMode.description: (Client) Function: render.PushFlashlightMode() Enables the flashlight projection for the upcoming rendering.

render.PushRenderTarget.body: render.PushRenderTarget(${1:ITexture texture}, ${2:number x=0}, ${3:number y=0}, ${4:number w=texture:Width()}, ${5:number h=texture:Height()})$0
render.PushRenderTarget.description: (Client) Function: render.PushRenderTarget() Pushes the current render target and viewport to the RT stack then sets a new current render target and viewport. If the viewport is not specified, the dimensions of the render target are used instead.

render.ReadPixel.description: (Client) Function: render.ReadPixel() Reads the color of the specified pixel from the RenderTarget sent by {{LibraryFunction|render|CapturePixels}}

render.RedownloadAllLightmaps.description: (Client) Function: render.RedownloadAllLightmaps() This applies the changes made to map lighting using {{LibraryFunction|engine|LightStyle}}.

render.RenderHUD.description: (Client) Function: render.RenderHUD() Renders the HUD on the screen.

render.RenderView.description: (Client) Function: render.RenderView() Renders the scene with the specified viewData to the current active render target.

render.ResetModelLighting.description: (Client) Function: render.ResetModelLighting() Resets the model lighting to the specified color.

render.ResetToneMappingScale.description: (Client) Function: render.ResetToneMappingScale() Resets the HDR tone multiplier to the specified value.

render.SetAmbientLight.description: (Client) Function: render.SetAmbientLight() Sets the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation.

render.SetBlend.description: (Client) Function: render.SetBlend() Sets the alpha blending for every upcoming render operation.

render.SetColorMaterial.description: (Client) Function: render.SetColorMaterial() Sets the current drawing material to "color".

render.SetColorMaterialIgnoreZ.description: (Client) Function: render.SetColorMaterialIgnoreZ() Sets the current drawing material to "color_ignorez".

render.SetColorModulation.description: (Client) Function: render.SetColorModulation() Sets the color modulation.

render.SetFogZ.description: (Client) Function: render.SetFogZ() If the fog mode is set to [[Enums/MATERIAL_FOG|MATERIAL_FOG_LINEAR_BELOW_FOG_Z]], the fog will only be rendered below the specified height.

render.SetGoalToneMappingScale.description: (Client) Function: render.SetGoalToneMappingScale() Sets the goal HDR tone mapping scale.

render.SetLightingMode.description: (Client) Function: render.SetLightingMode() Sets lighting mode when rendering something.

render.SetLightingOrigin.description: (Client) Function: render.SetLightingOrigin() Sets the lighting origin.

render.SetLightmapTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.SetLightmapTexture() Sets the texture to be used as the lightmap in upcoming rendering operations. This is required when rendering meshes using a material with a lightmapped shader such as LightmappedGeneric.

render.SetLocalModelLights.description: (Client) Function: render.SetLocalModelLights() Sets up the local lighting for any upcoming render operation. Up to 4 local lights can be defined, with one of three different types (point, directional, spot).

render.SetMaterial.description: (Client) Function: render.SetMaterial() Sets the material to be used in any upcoming render operation using the Lib library.

render.SetModelLighting.description: (Client) Function: render.SetModelLighting() Sets up the ambient lighting for any upcoming render operation. Ambient lighting can be seen as a cube enclosing the object to be drawn, each of its faces representing a directional light source that shines towards the object. Thus, there is a total of six different light sources that can be configured separately.

render.SetRenderTarget.description: (Client) Function: render.SetRenderTarget() Sets the render target to the specified rt.

render.SetRenderTargetEx.description: (Client) Function: render.SetRenderTargetEx() Sets the render target with the specified index to the specified rt.

render.SetScissorRect.body: render.SetScissorRect(${1:number startX}, ${2:number startY}, ${3:number endX}, ${4:number endY}, ${5:boolean enable})$0
render.SetScissorRect.description: (Client) Function: render.SetScissorRect() Sets a scissoring rect which limits the drawing area.

render.SetShadowColor.description: (Client) Function: render.SetShadowColor() Sets the shadow color.

render.SetShadowDirection.description: (Client) Function: render.SetShadowDirection() Sets the shadow projection direction.

render.SetShadowDistance.description: (Client) Function: render.SetShadowDistance() Sets the maximum shadow projection range.

render.SetShadowsDisabled.description: (Client) Function: render.SetShadowsDisabled() Sets whether any future render operations will ignore shadow drawing.

render.SetStencilCompareFunction.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilCompareFunction() Sets the compare function of the stencil.

render.SetStencilEnable.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilEnable() Sets whether stencil tests are carried out for each rendered pixel.

render.SetStencilFailOperation.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilFailOperation() Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was not successful.

render.SetStencilPassOperation.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilPassOperation() Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the compare function was successful.

render.SetStencilReferenceValue.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilReferenceValue() Sets the reference value which will be used for all stencil operations. This is an unsigned integer.

render.SetStencilTestMask.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilTestMask() Sets the unsigned 8-bit test bitflag mask to be used for any stencil testing.

render.SetStencilWriteMask.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilWriteMask() Sets the unsigned 8-bit write bitflag mask to be used for any writes to the stencil buffer.

render.SetStencilZFailOperation.description: (Client) Function: render.SetStencilZFailOperation() Sets the operation to be performed on the stencil buffer values if the stencil test is passed but the depth buffer test fails.

render.SetViewPort.description: (Client) Function: render.SetViewPort() Changes the view port position and size.

render.Spin.description: (Client) Function: render.Spin() Swaps the frame buffers/cycles the frame. In other words, this updates the screen.

render.StartBeam.description: (Client) Function: render.StartBeam() Start a new beam draw operation.

render.SupportsHDR.description: (Client) Function: render.SupportsHDR() Returns whether the game supports HDR, i.e. if the DirectX level is higher than or equal to 8.

render.SupportsPixelShaders_1_4.description: (Client) Function: render.SupportsPixelShaders_1_4() Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 1.4.

render.SupportsPixelShaders_2_0.description: (Client) Function: render.SupportsPixelShaders_2_0() Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of pixel shaders 2.0.

render.SupportsVertexShaders_2_0.description: (Client) Function: render.SupportsVertexShaders_2_0() Returns if the current settings and the system allow the usage of vertex shaders 2.0.

render.SuppressEngineLighting.description: (Client) Function: render.SuppressEngineLighting() Suppresses or enables any engine lighting for any upcoming render operation.

render.TurnOnToneMapping.description: (Client) Function: render.TurnOnToneMapping() Enables HDR tone mapping which influences the brightness.

render.UpdateFullScreenDepthTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.UpdateFullScreenDepthTexture() Updates the texture returned by {{LibraryFunction|render|GetFullScreenDepthTexture}}.

render.UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture() Updates the power of two texture.

render.UpdateRefractTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.UpdateRefractTexture() Pretty much alias of {{LibraryFunction|render|UpdatePowerOfTwoTexture}} but does not return the texture.

render.UpdateScreenEffectTexture.description: (Client) Function: render.UpdateScreenEffectTexture() Copies the entire screen to the screen effect texture, which can be acquired via {{LibraryFunction|render|GetScreenEffectTexture}}. This function is mainly intended to be used in {{HookFunction|GM|RenderScreenspaceEffects}}

resource.AddFile.description: (Server) Function: resource.AddFile() Adds the specified and all related files to the files the client should download.

resource.AddSingleFile.description: (Server) Function: resource.AddSingleFile() Adds the specified file to the files the client should download.

resource.AddWorkshop.description: (Server) Function: resource.AddWorkshop() Adds a workshop addon for the client to download before entering the server.

saverestore.AddRestoreHook.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.AddRestoreHook() Adds a restore/load hook for the Half-Life 2 save system.

saverestore.AddSaveHook.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.AddSaveHook() Adds a save hook for the Half-Life 2 save system. You can this to carry data through level transitions in Half-Life 2.

saverestore.LoadEntity.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.LoadEntity() Loads {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetTable}} from the save game file that is being loaded and merges it with the given entitys {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetTable}}.

saverestore.ReadTable.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.ReadTable() Reads a table from the save game file that is being loaded.

saverestore.ReadVar.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.ReadVar() Loads a variable from the save game file that is being loaded.

saverestore.SaveEntity.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.SaveEntity() Saves entitys {{ClassFunction|Entity|GetTable}} to the save game file that is being saved.

saverestore.WritableKeysInTable.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.WritableKeysInTable() Returns how many writable keys are in the given table.

saverestore.WriteTable.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.WriteTable() Write a table to a save game file that is being saved.

saverestore.WriteVar.description: (Shared) Function: saverestore.WriteVar() Writes a variable to the save game file that is being saved.

scripted_ents.Alias.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.Alias() Defines an alias string that can be used to refer to another classname

scripted_ents.Get.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.Get() Returns a copy of the ENT table for a class, including functions defined by the base class

scripted_ents.GetList.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.GetList() Returns a copy of the list of all ENT tables registered

scripted_ents.GetMember.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.GetMember() Retrieves a member of entity's table.

scripted_ents.GetSpawnable.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.GetSpawnable() Returns a list of all ENT tables which contain either ENT.Spawnable or ENT.AdminSpawnable

scripted_ents.GetStored.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.GetStored() Returns the actual ENT table for a class. Modifying functions/variables in this table will change newly spawned entities

scripted_ents.GetType.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.GetType() Returns the 'type' of a class, this will one of the following: 'anim', 'ai', 'brush', 'point'.

scripted_ents.IsBasedOn.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.IsBasedOn() Checks if name is based on base

scripted_ents.Register.description: (Shared) Function: scripted_ents.Register() Registers an ENT table with a classname. Reregistering an existing classname will automatically update the functions of all existing entities of that class.

search.AddProvider.description: (Client) Function: search.AddProvider() Adds a search result provider. For examples, see gamemodes/sandbox/gamemode/cl_search_models.lua

serverlist.PlayerList.description: (Menu) Function: serverlist.PlayerList() Queries a server for its player list.

serverlist.Query.description: (Menu) Function: serverlist.Query() Queries the master server for server list.

sound.Add.description: (Shared) Function: sound.Add() Creates a sound script. It can also override sounds, which seems to only work when set on the server.

sound.AddSoundOverrides.description: (Shared) Function: sound.AddSoundOverrides() Overrides sounds defined inside of a txt file; typically used for adding map-specific sounds.

sound.Generate.description: (Client) Function: sound.Generate() Creates a sound from a function.

sound.GetProperties.description: (Shared) Function: sound.GetProperties() Returns properties of the soundscript.

sound.GetTable.description: (Shared) Function: sound.GetTable() Returns a list of all registered sound scripts.

sound.Play.body: sound.Play(${1:string Name}, ${2:Vector Pos}, ${3:number Level}, ${4:number Pitch}, ${5:number Volume})$0
sound.Play.description: (Shared) Function: sound.Play() Plays a sound from the specified position in the world.

sound.PlayFile.description: (Client) Function: sound.PlayFile() Plays a file from GMod directory. You can find a list of all error codes [http://www.un4seen.com/doc/#bass/BASS_ErrorGetCode.html here]

sound.PlayURL.description: (Client) Function: sound.PlayURL() Allows you to play external sound files, as well as online radio streams.

spawnmenu.ActivateTool.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.ActivateTool() Activates a tool, opens context menu and brings up the tool gun.

spawnmenu.ActivateToolPanel.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.ActivateToolPanel() Activates tools context menu in specified tool tab.

spawnmenu.ActiveControlPanel.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.ActiveControlPanel() Returns currently opened control panel of a tool, post process effect or some other menu in spawnmenu.

spawnmenu.AddContentType.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.AddContentType() Registers a new content type that is saveable into spawnlists.

spawnmenu.AddCreationTab.body: spawnmenu.AddCreationTab(${1:string name}, ${2:function function}, ${3:string material="icon16/exclamation.png"}, ${4:number order=1000}, ${5:string tooltip=nil})$0
spawnmenu.AddCreationTab.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.AddCreationTab() Inserts a new tab into the CreationMenus table, which will be used by the creation menu to generate its tabs (Spawnlists, Weapons, Entities, etc.)

spawnmenu.AddPropCategory.body: spawnmenu.AddPropCategory(${1:string filename}, ${2:string name}, ${3:table contents}, ${4:string icon}, ${5:number id=1000}, ${6:number parentID=0}, ${7:string needsApp=""})$0
spawnmenu.AddPropCategory.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.AddPropCategory() {{Internal|You should never try to modify player's customized spawnlists.}} {{Deprecated|You should never try to modify player's customized spawnlists.}}Used to populate prop categories in the spawnmenu tree. This function should generally be called within {{HookFunction|SANDBOX|PopulatePropMenu}}.

spawnmenu.AddToolCategory.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.AddToolCategory() Used to create a new category in the list inside of a spawnmenu ToolTab.

spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption.body: spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption(${1:string tab}, ${2:string category}, ${3:string class}, ${4:string name}, ${5:string cmd}, ${6:string config}, ${7:function cpanel}, ${8:table })$0
spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.AddToolMenuOption() Adds an option to the right side of the spawnmenu

spawnmenu.AddToolTab.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.AddToolTab() Used to create a new Utility tab inside of the spawnmenu to place more content into. You must call from {{HookFunction|SANDBOX|AddToolMenuTabs}} for it to add work correctly.

spawnmenu.CreateContentIcon.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.CreateContentIcon() Creates a new content icon.

spawnmenu.GetContentType.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.GetContentType() Returns the function to create an vgui element for a specified content type

spawnmenu.GetCreationTabs.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.GetCreationTabs() Gets the CreationMenus table, which was filled with creation menu tabs from {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|AddCreationTab}}.

spawnmenu.GetPropTable.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.GetPropTable() Returns a table of all prop categories and their props in the spawnmenu. Note that if the spawnmenu has not been populated, this will return an empty table.

spawnmenu.GetTools.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.GetTools() Gets a table of tools on the client.

spawnmenu.PopulateFromTextFiles.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.PopulateFromTextFiles() Loads spawnlists from text files.

spawnmenu.SetActiveControlPanel.description: (Client) Function: spawnmenu.SetActiveControlPanel() Sets currently active control panel to be returned by {{LibraryFunction|spawnmenu|ActiveControlPanel}}.

sql.Begin.description: (All) Function: sql.Begin() Tells the engine a set of queries is coming. Will wait until {{LibraryFunction|sql|Commit}} is called to run them.

sql.Commit.description: (All) Function: sql.Commit() Tells the engine to execute a series of queries queued for execution, must be preceded by {{LibraryFunction|sql|Begin}}

sql.LastError.description: (All) Function: sql.LastError() Returns the last error from a SQLite query.

sql.Query.description: (All) Function: sql.Query() Performs a query on the local SQLite database, returns a table as result set, nil if result is empty and false on error.

sql.QueryRow.description: (All) Function: sql.QueryRow() Performs the query like {{LibraryFunction|sql|Query}}, but returns the first row found.

sql.QueryValue.description: (All) Function: sql.QueryValue() Performs the query like {{LibraryFunction|sql|Query}}, but returns the first value found.

sql.SQLStr.description: (All) Function: sql.SQLStr() Escapes dangerous characters and symbols from user input used in an SQLite SQL Query.

sql.TableExists.description: (All) Function: sql.TableExists() Returns if the table with the specified name exists.

steamworks.Download.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.Download() Downloads a file from the supplied addon and saves it as a .cache file in garrysmod/cache folder.

steamworks.FileInfo.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.FileInfo() Retrieves info about supplied Steam Workshop addon.

steamworks.GetList.body: steamworks.GetList(${1:string type}, ${2:table tags}, ${3:number offset}, ${4:number numRetrieve}, ${5:number days}, ${6:string userID}, ${7:function resultCallback})$0
steamworks.GetList.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.GetList() Retrieves a customized list of Steam Workshop addons.

steamworks.GetPlayerName.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.GetPlayerName() Retrieves players name by his 64bit SteamID.

steamworks.IsSubscribed.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.IsSubscribed() Returns whenever the client is subscribed to the specified Steam Workshop item.

steamworks.OpenWorkshop.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.OpenWorkshop() Opens the workshop website in the steam overlay browser.

steamworks.Publish.body: steamworks.Publish(${1:table tags}, ${2:string filename}, ${3:string image}, ${4:string name}, ${5:string desc})$0

steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.RequestPlayerInfo() Requests information of the player with SteamID64 for later use with {{LibraryFunction|steamworks|GetPlayerName}}.

steamworks.SetFilePlayed.description: (Menu) Function: steamworks.SetFilePlayed() Sets whether you have played this addon or not. This will be shown to the user in the Steam Workshop itself:

steamworks.SetShouldMountAddon.description: (Menu) Function: steamworks.SetShouldMountAddon() Sets if an addon should be enabled or disabled. Call {{LibraryFunction|steamworks|ApplyAddons}} afterwards to update.

steamworks.ShouldMountAddon.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.ShouldMountAddon() Returns whenever the specified Steam Workshop addon will be mounted or not.

steamworks.Unsubscribe.description: (Menu) Function: steamworks.Unsubscribe() {{Internal}} Unsubscribes to the specified workshop addon. Call {{LibraryFunction|steamworks|ApplyAddons}} afterwards to update.

steamworks.ViewFile.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.ViewFile() Opens the workshop website for specified Steam Workshop item in the Steam overlay browser.

steamworks.Vote.description: (Menu) Function: steamworks.Vote() {{Internal}} Makes the user vote for the specified addon

steamworks.VoteInfo.description: (Client and Menu) Function: steamworks.VoteInfo() Retrieves vote info of supplied addon.

string.byte.description: (All) Function: string.byte() Returns the given string's characters in their numeric ASCII representation.

string.char.description: (All) Function: string.char() Takes the given numerical bytes and converts them to a string.

string.Comma.description: (All) Function: string.Comma() Inserts commas for every third digit.

string.dump.description: (All) Function: string.dump() Returns the binary bytecode of the given function.

string.EndsWith.description: (All) Function: string.EndsWith() Returns whether or not the second passed string matches the end of the first.

string.Explode.description: (All) Function: string.Explode() Splits a string up wherever it finds the given separator.

string.find.description: (All) Function: string.find() Attempts to find the specified substring in a string, uses [[Patterns]] by default.

string.format.description: (All) Function: string.format() Formats the specified values into the string given.

string.FormattedTime.description: (All) Function: string.FormattedTime() Returns the time as a formatted string or as a table if no format is given.

string.FromColor.description: (All) Function: string.FromColor() Creates a string from a Color variable.

string.GetChar.description: (All) Function: string.GetChar() {{Deprecated|Use either string.sub(str, index, index) or str[index].}} Returns char value from the specified index in the supplied string.

string.GetExtensionFromFilename.description: (All) Function: string.GetExtensionFromFilename() Returns extension of the file.

string.GetFileFromFilename.description: (All) Function: string.GetFileFromFilename() Returns file name and extension.

string.GetPathFromFilename.description: (All) Function: string.GetPathFromFilename() Returns the path only from a file's path.

string.gfind.description: (All) Function: string.gfind() {{Deprecated|This function is removed in Lua versions later than what GMod is currently using. Use {{LibraryFunction|string|gmatch}} instead.}}Returns an iterator function that is called for every complete match of the pattern, all sub matches will be passed as to the loop.

string.gmatch.description: (All) Function: string.gmatch() Using [[Patterns]], returns an iterator which will return either one value if no capture groups are defined, or any capture group matches.

string.gsub.description: (All) Function: string.gsub() This functions main purpose is to replace certain character sequences in a string using [[Patterns]].

string.Implode.description: (All) Function: string.Implode() Joins the values of a table together to form a string.

string.JavascriptSafe.description: (All) Function: string.JavascriptSafe() Escapes special characters for JavaScript in a string, making the string safe for inclusion in to JavaScript strings.

string.Left.description: (All) Function: string.Left() Returns everything left of supplied place of that string.

string.len.description: (All) Function: string.len() Counts the number of characters in the string (length). This is equivalent to using the length operator (#).

string.lower.description: (All) Function: string.lower() Changes any upper-case letters in a string to lower-case letters.

string.match.description: (All) Function: string.match() Finds a [[Patterns|Pattern]] in a string.

string.NiceSize.description: (All) Function: string.NiceSize() Converts a digital filesize to human-readable text.

string.NiceTime.description: (All) Function: string.NiceTime() Converts supplied number into string.

string.PatternSafe.description: (All) Function: string.PatternSafe() Escapes all special characters within a string, making the string safe for inclusion in a Lua pattern.

string.rep.description: (All) Function: string.rep() Repeats a string by the provided number, with an optional separator.

string.Replace.description: (All) Function: string.Replace() Replaces all occurrences of the supplied second string.

string.Right.description: (All) Function: string.Right() Returns the last n-th characters of the string.

string.SetChar.description: (All) Function: string.SetChar() Sets the character at the specific index of the string.

string.Split.description: (All) Function: string.Split() Splits the string into a table of strings, separated by the second argument.

string.StartWith.description: (All) Function: string.StartWith() Returns whether or not the first string starts with the second.

string.StripExtension.description: (All) Function: string.StripExtension() Removes the extension of a path.

string.sub.description: (All) Function: string.sub() Returns a sub-string, starting from the character at position ''StartPos'' of the string (inclusive), and optionally ending at the character at position ''EndPos'' of the string (also inclusive). If EndPos is not given, the rest of the string is returned.

string.ToColor.description: (All) Function: string.ToColor() Fetches a Color type from a string.

string.ToMinutesSeconds.description: (All) Function: string.ToMinutesSeconds() Returns given time in "MM:SS" format.

string.ToMinutesSecondsMilliseconds.description: (All) Function: string.ToMinutesSecondsMilliseconds() Returns given time in "MM:SS:MS" format.

string.ToTable.description: (All) Function: string.ToTable() Splits the string into characters and creates a sequential table.

string.Trim.description: (All) Function: string.Trim() Removes leading and trailing matches of a string.

string.TrimLeft.description: (All) Function: string.TrimLeft() Removes leading spaces/characters from a string.

string.TrimRight.description: (All) Function: string.TrimRight() Removes trailing spaces/passed character from a string.

string.upper.description: (All) Function: string.upper() Changes any lower-case letters in a string to upper-case letters.

surface.CreateFont.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.CreateFont() Creates a new font.

surface.DisableClipping.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DisableClipping() Enables or disables the clipping used by the VGUI that limits the drawing operations to a panels bounds.

surface.DrawCircle.body: surface.DrawCircle(${1:number originX}, ${2:number originY}, ${3:number radius}, ${4:number r}, ${5:number g}, ${6:number b}, ${7:number a=255})$0
surface.DrawCircle.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawCircle() Draws a hollow circle, made of dots. For a filled circle, see examples for {{LibraryFunction|surface|DrawPoly}}.

surface.DrawLine.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawLine() Draws a line from one point to another.

surface.DrawOutlinedRect.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawOutlinedRect() Draws a hollow box with a border width of 1 px.

surface.DrawPoly.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawPoly() Draws a polygon with a maximum of 256 vertices.

surface.DrawRect.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawRect() Draws a solid rectangle on the screen.

surface.DrawText.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawText() Draw the specified text on the screen, using the previously set position, font and color.

surface.DrawTexturedRect.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawTexturedRect() Draw a textured rectangle with the given position and dimensions on the screen, using the current active texture.

surface.DrawTexturedRectRotated.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawTexturedRectRotated() Draw a textured rotated rectangle with the given position and dimensions and angle on the screen, using the current active texture.

surface.DrawTexturedRectUV.body: surface.DrawTexturedRectUV(${1:number x}, ${2:number y}, ${3:number width}, ${4:number height}, ${5:number startU}, ${6:number startV}, ${7:number endU}, ${8:number endV})$0
surface.DrawTexturedRectUV.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.DrawTexturedRectUV() Draws a textured rectangle with a repeated or partial texture.

surface.GetHUDTexture.description: (Client) Function: surface.GetHUDTexture() Gets the HUD texture with the specified name.

surface.GetTextSize.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.GetTextSize() Returns the width and height (in pixels) of the given text, but only if the font has been set with {{LibraryFunction|surface|SetFont}}.

surface.GetTextureID.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.GetTextureID() Returns the texture id of the material with the given name/path.

surface.GetTextureSize.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.GetTextureSize() Returns the size of the texture with the associated texture ID.

surface.PlaySound.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.PlaySound() Play a sound file directly on the client (such as UI sounds, etc).

surface.ScreenHeight.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.ScreenHeight() {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|ScrH}} instead.}}

surface.ScreenWidth.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.ScreenWidth() {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|ScrW}} instead.}}

surface.SetAlphaMultiplier.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetAlphaMultiplier() Sets a multiplier that will influence all upcoming drawing operations.

surface.SetDrawColor.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetDrawColor() Set the color of any future shapes to be drawn, can be set by either using r, g, b, a as separate values or by a {{Struct|Color}}. Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.

surface.SetFont.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetFont() Set the current font to be used for text operations later.

surface.SetMaterial.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetMaterial() Sets the material to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

surface.SetTextColor.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetTextColor() Set the color of any future text to be drawn, can be set by either using r, g, b, a as separate values or by a {{Struct|Color}}. Using a color structure is not recommended to be created procedurally.

surface.SetTextPos.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetTextPos() Set the position to draw any future text.

surface.SetTexture.description: (Client and Menu) Function: surface.SetTexture() Sets the texture to be used in all upcoming draw operations using the surface library.

system.AppTime.description: (All) Function: system.AppTime() Returns the total uptime of the current application as reported by Steam.

system.BatteryPower.description: (All) Function: system.BatteryPower() Returns the current battery power.

system.FlashWindow.description: (Client and Menu) Function: system.FlashWindow() Flashes the window. Currently works only on Windows.

system.GetCountry.description: (All) Function: system.GetCountry() Returns the country code of this computer, determined by the localisation settings of the OS.

system.HasFocus.description: (All) Function: system.HasFocus() Returns whether or not the game window has focus.

system.IsLinux.description: (All) Function: system.IsLinux() Returns whether the current OS is Linux.
