system.IsOSX.description: (All) Function: system.IsOSX() Returns whether the current OS is OSX.

system.IsWindowed.description: (Client and Menu) Function: system.IsWindowed() Returns whether the game is being run in a window or in fullscreen (you can change this by opening the menu, clicking 'Options', then clicking the 'Video' tab, and changing the Display Mode using the dropdown menu):

system.IsWindows.description: (All) Function: system.IsWindows() Returns whether the current OS is Windows.

system.SteamTime.description: (All) Function: system.SteamTime() Returns the synchronized Steam time. This is the number of seconds since the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time Unix epoch].

system.UpTime.description: (All) Function: system.UpTime() Returns the amount of seconds since the Steam user last moved their mouse.

table.Add.description: (All) Function: table.Add() Adds the contents from one table into another.

table.ClearKeys.description: (All) Function: table.ClearKeys() Changes all keys to sequential integers. This creates a new table object and does not affect the original.

table.CollapseKeyValue.description: (All) Function: table.CollapseKeyValue() Collapses a table with keyvalue structure

table.concat.description: (All) Function: table.concat() Concatenates the contents of a table to a string.

table.Copy.description: (All) Function: table.Copy() Creates a deep copy and returns that copy.

table.CopyFromTo.description: (All) Function: table.CopyFromTo() Empties the target table, and merges all values from the source table into it.

table.Count.description: (All) Function: table.Count() Counts the amount of keys in a table. This should only be used when a table is not numerically and sequentially indexed. For those tables, consider the length operator.

table.DeSanitise.description: (All) Function: table.DeSanitise() Converts a table that has been sanitised with {{LibraryFunction|table|Sanitise}} back to its original form

table.Empty.description: (All) Function: table.Empty() Removes all values from a table.

table.FindNext.description: (All) Function: table.FindNext() {{Deprecated|Instead, iterate the table using ipairs or increment from the previous index. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.}}

table.FindPrev.description: (All) Function: table.FindPrev() {{Deprecated|Instead, iterate your table with ipairs, storing the previous value and checking for the target. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered.}}

table.ForceInsert.description: (All) Function: table.ForceInsert() Inserts a value in to the given table even if the table is non-existent

table.foreach.description: (All) Function: table.foreach() {{Deprecated|This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use {{GlobalFunction|pairs}}() instead.}} Iterates for each key-value pair in the table, calling the function with the key and value of the pair. If the function returns anything, the loop is broken.

table.ForEach.description: (All) Function: table.ForEach() {{Deprecated|You should use {{GlobalFunction|pairs}}() instead.}} Iterates over a table and calls the given function for each key and value found. Unlike {{LibraryFunction|table|foreach}}, this ignores the value returned by the function.

table.foreachi.description: (All) Function: table.foreachi() {{Deprecated|This was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and removed in 5.2. You should use {{GlobalFunction|ipairs}}() instead.}} Iterates for each numeric index in the table in order.

table.GetFirstKey.description: (All) Function: table.GetFirstKey() {{Deprecated|Instead, expect the first key to be 1.

table.GetFirstValue.description: (All) Function: table.GetFirstValue() {{Deprecated|Instead, index the table with a key of 1.

table.GetKeys.description: (All) Function: table.GetKeys() Returns all keys of a table.

table.GetLastKey.description: (All) Function: table.GetLastKey() {{Deprecated|Instead, use the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.}}

table.GetLastValue.description: (All) Function: table.GetLastValue() {{Deprecated|Instead, index the table with the result of the length (#) operator, ensuring it is not zero. Non-numerically indexed tables are not ordered and do not have a last key.}}

table.getn.description: (All) Function: table.getn() {{Deprecated|This function was deprecated in Lua 5.1 and is removed in 5.2. Use the length (#) operator instead.}} Returns the length of the table.

table.GetWinningKey.description: (All) Function: table.GetWinningKey() Returns a key of the supplied table with the highest number value.

table.HasValue.description: (All) Function: table.HasValue() Checks if a table has a value.

table.Inherit.description: (All) Function: table.Inherit() Copies any missing data from base to target, and sets the target's ''BaseClass'' member to the base table's pointer.

table.insert.description: (All) Function: table.insert() Inserts a value into a table at the end of the table or at the given position.

table.IsSequential.description: (All) Function: table.IsSequential() Returns whether or not the table's keys are sequential

table.KeyFromValue.description: (All) Function: table.KeyFromValue() Returns the first key found to be containing the supplied value

table.KeysFromValue.description: (All) Function: table.KeysFromValue() Returns a table of keys containing the supplied value

table.LowerKeyNames.description: (All) Function: table.LowerKeyNames() Returns a copy of the input table with all string keys converted to be lowercase recursively

table.maxn.description: (All) Function: table.maxn() Returns the highest numerical key.

table.Merge.description: (All) Function: table.Merge() Merges the content of the second table with the content in the first one

table.Random.description: (All) Function: table.Random() Returns a random value from the supplied table.

table.remove.description: (All) Function: table.remove() Removes a value from a table and shifts any other values down to fill the gap.

table.RemoveByValue.description: (All) Function: table.RemoveByValue() Removes the first instance of a given value from the specified table with {{LibraryFunction|table|remove}}, then returns the key that the value was found at.

table.Reverse.description: (All) Function: table.Reverse() Returns a reversed copy of a sequential table. Any non-sequential and non-numeric keyvalue pairs will not be copied.

table.Sanitise.description: (All) Function: table.Sanitise() Converts Vector}}s, {{Type|Angle}}s and {{Type|boolean}}s to be able to be converted to and from key-values. {{LibraryFunction|table|DeSanitise does the opposite

table.sort.description: (All) Function: table.sort() Sorts a table either ascending or by the given sort function.

table.SortByKey.description: (All) Function: table.SortByKey() Returns a list of keys sorted based on values of those keys.

table.SortByMember.description: (All) Function: table.SortByMember() Sorts a table by a named member

table.SortDesc.description: (All) Function: table.SortDesc() Sorts a table in reverse order from {{LibraryFunction|table|sort}}

table.ToString.description: (All) Function: table.ToString() Converts a table into a string

team.AddScore.description: (Shared) Function: team.AddScore() Increases the score of the given team

team.BestAutoJoinTeam.description: (Shared) Function: team.BestAutoJoinTeam() Returns the team index of the team with the least players. Falls back to TEAM_UNASSIGNED

team.GetAllTeams.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetAllTeams() Returns a table consisting of information on every defined team

team.GetClass.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetClass() Returns the selectable classes for the given team. This can be added to with [[team/SetClass]]

team.GetColor.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetColor() Returns the team's color.

team.GetName.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetName() Returns the name of the team.

team.GetPlayers.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetPlayers() Returns a table with all player of the specified team.

team.GetScore.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetScore() Returns the score of the team.

team.GetSpawnPoint.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetSpawnPoint() Returns a table of valid spawnpoint classes the team can use. These are set with {{LibraryFunction|team|SetSpawnPoint}}.

team.GetSpawnPoints.description: (Shared) Function: team.GetSpawnPoints() Returns a table of valid spawnpoint entities the team can use. These are set with  {{LibraryFunction|team|SetSpawnPoint}}.

team.Joinable.description: (Shared) Function: team.Joinable() Returns if a team is joinable or not. This is set in {{LibraryFunction|team|SetUp}}.

team.NumPlayers.description: (Shared) Function: team.NumPlayers() Returns the amount of players in a team.

team.SetClass.description: (Shared) Function: team.SetClass() Sets valid classes for use by a team. Classes can be created using {{LibraryFunction|player_manager|RegisterClass}}

team.SetColor.description: (Shared) Function: team.SetColor() Sets the team's color.

team.SetScore.description: (Shared) Function: team.SetScore() Sets the score of the given team

team.SetSpawnPoint.description: (Shared) Function: team.SetSpawnPoint() Sets valid spawnpoint classes for use by a team.

team.SetUp.description: (Shared) Function: team.SetUp() Creates a new team.

team.TotalDeaths.description: (Shared) Function: team.TotalDeaths() Returns the sum of deaths of all players of the team.

team.TotalFrags.description: (Shared) Function: team.TotalFrags() Get's the total frags in a team.

team.Valid.description: (Shared) Function: team.Valid() Returns true if the given team index is valid

timer.Adjust.description: (All) Function: timer.Adjust() Adjusts the timer if the timer with the given identifier exists.

timer.Check.description: (All) Function: timer.Check() {{Deprecated}} This function does nothing.

timer.Create.description: (All) Function: timer.Create() Creates a new timer.

timer.Destroy.description: (All) Function: timer.Destroy() {{Deprecated|You should be using {{LibraryFunction|timer|Remove}} instead.}} Stops and destroys the given timer. Alias of {{LibraryFunction|timer|Remove}}.

timer.Exists.description: (All) Function: timer.Exists() Returns whenever the given timer exists or not.

timer.Pause.description: (All) Function: timer.Pause() Pauses the given timer.

timer.Remove.description: (All) Function: timer.Remove() Stops and removes the timer.

timer.RepsLeft.description: (All) Function: timer.RepsLeft() Returns amount of repetitions/executions left before the timer destroys itself.

timer.Simple.description: (All) Function: timer.Simple() Runs the given function after a specified delay.

timer.Start.description: (All) Function: timer.Start() Restarts the given timer.

timer.Stop.description: (All) Function: timer.Stop() Stops the given timer and rewinds it.

timer.TimeLeft.description: (All) Function: timer.TimeLeft() Returns amount of time left (in seconds) before the timer executes its function.

timer.Toggle.description: (All) Function: timer.Toggle() Runs either {{LibraryFunction|timer|Pause}} or {{LibraryFunction|timer|UnPause}} based on the timer's current status.

umsg.Angle.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Angle() Writes an angle to the usermessage.

umsg.Bool.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Bool() Writes a bool to the usermessage.

umsg.Char.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Char() Writes a signed char to the usermessage.

umsg.End.description: (Server) Function: umsg.End() Dispatches the usermessage to the client(s).

umsg.Entity.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Entity() Writes an entity object to the usermessage.

umsg.Float.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Float() Writes a float to the usermessage.

umsg.Long.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Long() Writes a signed int (32 bit) to the usermessage.

umsg.Short.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Short() Writes a signed short (16 bit) to the usermessage.

umsg.Start.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Start() {{Deprecated|You should be using {{Lib|net}} instead}}

umsg.String.description: (Server) Function: umsg.String() Writes a null terminated string to the usermessage.

umsg.Vector.description: (Server) Function: umsg.Vector() Writes a Vector to the usermessage.

umsg.VectorNormal.description: (Server) Function: umsg.VectorNormal() Writes a vector normal to the usermessage.

undo.AddEntity.description: (Server) Function: undo.AddEntity() Adds an entity to the current undo block

undo.AddFunction.description: (Server) Function: undo.AddFunction() Adds a function to call when the current undo block is undone

undo.Create.description: (Server) Function: undo.Create() Begins a new undo entry

undo.Do_Undo.description: (Server) Function: undo.Do_Undo() Processes an undo block (in table form). This is used internally by the undo manager when a player presses Z.

undo.Finish.description: (Shared) Function: undo.Finish() Completes an undo entry, and registers it with the player's client

undo.GetTable.description: (Shared) Function: undo.GetTable() Serverside, returns a table containing all undo blocks of all players. Clientside, returns a table of the local player's undo blocks.

undo.ReplaceEntity.description: (Server) Function: undo.ReplaceEntity() Replaces any instance of the "from" reference with the "to" reference, in any existing undo block. Returns true if something was replaced

undo.SetCustomUndoText.description: (Server) Function: undo.SetCustomUndoText() Sets a custom undo text for the current undo block

undo.SetPlayer.description: (Server) Function: undo.SetPlayer() Sets the player which the current undo block belongs to

usermessage.GetTable.description: (Shared) Function: usermessage.GetTable() Returns a table of every usermessage hook

usermessage.Hook.description: (Shared) Function: usermessage.Hook() {{Deprecated|You should be using {{Lib|net}} instead}}

usermessage.IncomingMessage.description: (Shared) Function: usermessage.IncomingMessage() Called by the engine when a usermessage arrives, this method calls the hook function specified by {{LibraryFunction|usermessage|Hook}} if any.

utf8.char.description: (Shared) Function: utf8.char() Receives zero or more integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

utf8.codepoint.description: (Shared) Function: utf8.codepoint() Returns the codepoints (as numbers) from all characters in the given string that start between byte position startPos and endPos. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence. This functions similarly to {{LibraryFunction|string|byte}}.

utf8.force.description: (Shared) Function: utf8.force() Forces a string to contain only valid UTF-8 data. Invalid sequences are replaced with U+FFFD (the Unicode replacement character).

utf8.len.description: (Shared) Function: utf8.len() Returns the number of UTF-8 sequences in the given string between positions startPos and endPos (both inclusive). If it finds any invalid UTF-8 byte sequence, returns false as well as the position of the first invalid byte.

utf8.offset.body: utf8.offset(${1:string string}, ${2:number n}, ${3:number startPos=1 when n>=0, -1 otherwise})$0
utf8.offset.description: (Shared) Function: utf8.offset() Returns the byte-index of the n'th UTF-8-character after the given startPos (nil if none). startPos defaults to 1 when n is positive and -1 when n is negative. If n is zero, this function instead returns the byte-index of the UTF-8-character startPos lies within.

util.AddNetworkString.description: (Server) Function: util.AddNetworkString() Adds the specified string to a string table, which will cache it and network it to all clients automatically.

util.AimVector.body: util.AimVector(${1:Angle ViewAngles}, ${2:number ViewFOV}, ${3:number x}, ${4:number y}, ${5:number scrWidth}, ${6:number scrHeight})$0
util.AimVector.description: (All) Function: util.AimVector() Function used to calculate aim vector from 2D screen position. It is used in SuperDOF calculate Distance.

util.Base64Encode.description: (All) Function: util.Base64Encode() Encodes the specified string to base64.

util.BlastDamage.body: util.BlastDamage(${1:Entity inflictor}, ${2:Entity attacker}, ${3:Vector damageOrigin}, ${4:number damageRadius}, ${5:number damage})$0
util.BlastDamage.description: (Server) Function: util.BlastDamage() Applies explosion damage to all entities in the specified radius.

util.BlastDamageInfo.description: (Server) Function: util.BlastDamageInfo() Applies spherical damage based on damage info to all entities in the specified radius.

util.Compress.description: (All) Function: util.Compress() Compresses the given string using the [[wikipedia:LZMA|LZMA]] algorithm.

util.CRC.description: (Shared) Function: util.CRC() Generates the [[wikipedia:Cyclic redundancy check|CRC checksum]] of the specified string.

util.DateStamp.description: (All) Function: util.DateStamp() Returns the current date formatted like '2012-10-31 18-00-00'

util.Decal.description: (Shared) Function: util.Decal() Performs a trace and paints a decal to the surface hit.

util.DecalEx.body: util.DecalEx(${1:IMaterial material}, ${2:Entity ent}, ${3:Vector position}, ${4:Vector normal}, ${5:table color}, ${6:number w}, ${7:number h})$0
util.DecalEx.description: (Client) Function: util.DecalEx() Performs a trace and paints a decal to the surface hit.

util.DecalMaterial.description: (Shared) Function: util.DecalMaterial() Gets the full material path by the decal name.

util.Decompress.description: (All) Function: util.Decompress() Decompresses the given string using [[wikipedia:LZMA|LZMA]] algorithm. Used to decompress strings previously compressed with {{LibraryFunction|util|Compress}}.

util.DistanceToLine.description: (Shared) Function: util.DistanceToLine() Gets the distance between a line and a point in 3d space.

util.Effect.description: (Shared) Function: util.Effect() Creates a effect with the specified data.

util.GetModelInfo.description: (Shared) Function: util.GetModelInfo() Returns a table containing the info about the model. It seems to be not working serverside, but still exists serverside.

util.GetPData.description: (All) Function: util.GetPData() Gets PData of an offline player using their SteamID

util.GetPixelVisibleHandle.description: (Client) Function: util.GetPixelVisibleHandle() Creates a new PixVis handle. See {{LibraryFunction|util|PixelVisible}}.

util.GetPlayerTrace.description: (All) Function: util.GetPlayerTrace() Utility function to quickly generate a trace table that starts at the players view position, and ends 16384 units along a specified direction.

util.GetSunInfo.description: (Client) Function: util.GetSunInfo() Gets information about the sun position and obstruction or nil if there is no sun.

util.GetSurfaceIndex.description: (Shared) Function: util.GetSurfaceIndex() Returns the matching surface index for the surface name.

util.GetSurfacePropName.description: (Shared) Function: util.GetSurfacePropName() Returns a name of surfaceproperties ID.

util.GetUserGroups.description: (Server) Function: util.GetUserGroups() Returns a table of all SteamIDs that have a usergroup.

util.IntersectRayWithOBB.body: util.IntersectRayWithOBB(${1:Vector rayStart}, ${2:Vector rayDirection}, ${3:Vector boxOrigin}, ${4:Angle boxAngles}, ${5:Vector boxMins}, ${6:Vector boxMaxs})$0
util.IntersectRayWithOBB.description: (Shared) Function: util.IntersectRayWithOBB() Performs a ray box intersection and returns position, normal and the fraction.

util.IntersectRayWithPlane.description: (Shared) Function: util.IntersectRayWithPlane() Performs a ray plane intersection and returns the hit position or nil.

util.IsInWorld.description: (Server) Function: util.IsInWorld() Checks if a certain position in within the world bounds.

util.IsModelLoaded.description: (Shared) Function: util.IsModelLoaded() Checks if the model is loaded in the game.

util.IsSkyboxVisibleFromPoint.description: (Client) Function: util.IsSkyboxVisibleFromPoint() Check whether the skybox is visibile from the point specified.

util.IsValidModel.description: (Shared) Function: util.IsValidModel() Checks if the specified model is valid.

util.IsValidPhysicsObject.description: (All) Function: util.IsValidPhysicsObject() Checks if given numbered physics object of given entity is valid or not. Most useful for ragdolls.

util.IsValidProp.description: (Shared) Function: util.IsValidProp() Checks if the specified prop is valid.

util.IsValidRagdoll.description: (Shared) Function: util.IsValidRagdoll() Checks if the specified model name points to a valid ragdoll.

util.JSONToTable.description: (All) Function: util.JSONToTable() Converts a JSON string to a Lua table.

util.KeyValuesToTable.description: (All) Function: util.KeyValuesToTable() Converts a KeyValue string to a Lua table.

util.KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder.description: (All) Function: util.KeyValuesToTablePreserveOrder() Similar to {{LibraryFunction|util|KeyValuesToTable}} but it also preserves order of keys.

util.LocalToWorld.description: (All) Function: util.LocalToWorld() Returns a vector in world coordinates based on an entity and local coordinates

util.NetworkIDToString.description: (Shared) Function: util.NetworkIDToString() Returns the networked string associated with the given ID from the string table.

util.NetworkStringToID.description: (Shared) Function: util.NetworkStringToID() Returns the networked ID associated with the given string from the string table.
